alert.note: Alert for Kent; Providence (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 05 at 7:27PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern Rhode Island, including the following counties, Kent and Providence. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 722 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to occasional heavy rain continuing. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen across much of Providence county with locally higher amounts. The Woonasquatucket River at Centerdale was rising rapidly and will likely rise above flood stage this evening. Other small rivers and streams may rise out of their banks and some roads may still be flooded. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Providence, Warwick, Cranston, Pawtucket, Coventry, Cumberland, North Providence, West Warwick, Johnston, Smithfield, Lincoln, Central Falls, Burrillville, North Smithfield, Scituate, Glocester and Foster. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
